snippet: The Obama administration is on the verge of backing an F.B.I. plan for an overhaul of surveillance laws that would make it easier to wiretap people who communicate over the Internet rather than by phone.
abstract: Obama administration is on verge of backing Federal Bureau of Investigation plan for sweeping overhaul of surveillance laws that would make it easier to wiretap people who communicate using the Internet rather than phone; plan is likely to set off debate over future of the Internet if the White House submits it to Congress.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is on the verge of backing an F.B.I. plan for an overhaul of surveillance laws that would make it easier to wiretap people who communicate over the Internet rather than by phone.

headline.seo: Obama May Back F.B.I. Plan to Wiretap Web Users
headline.main: U.S. Weighs Wide Overhaul of Wiretap Laws
headline.print_headline: U.S. Weighing Wide Overhaul Of Surveillance

keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
keywords.name: subject
